result.execSummary:
The defendant Reva D. Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all inmate earnings received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to make her supervising agent aware of any prescription prior to the prescription being filled. Defendant is to have a single physician to issue or approve any prescription the defendant receives.  Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Granted

3:45 pm case called. Attorney Mary Martha Prosser in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has read the submission provided earlier today by Attorney Prosser-which includes updated medical information not previoulsy provided, DOC safeguards in place for release, along with information regarding the inability of the institution to provide appropriate care for the defendant. DA Anderson makes statement regarding information provided and deferrs to court regarding request. Statement by Attorney Prosser regarding willingness of Dr. Weber to testify for the hearing today and makes further statement regarding request for the defendant's release. Attorney Prosser updates the court regarding SSI eligibility; however, defendant's health has deteriorated to the point where medical care is no longer an option and the defendant will now begin her end of life journey. Court makes statement regarding the motion made and will enter an order granting the modification of bifurcated sentence.
Letter to Court from Atty Mary Prosser, Dated 3/8/2018 Re: Release of Defendant
Extraordinary Health Condition - Denied by the Court

records.descr: Pet mod bifurcated sent denied-not public interest

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears via video from Taycheedah Correctional Institution.

Case called @ 3:02 p.m. Defendant Reva D. Martinez in court, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petition for Modification of Bifurcated Sentence due to an extraordinary health condition. Statement by DE in support of the request. Argument by DA Anderson - does object to modification as it is not in the public interest. Statement by DE. Statement by the Court. The Court does not find that it is in the public interest and respectfully declines to modify the sentence.
Modification of bifurcated sentence hearing on February 23, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:05 am case called. Defendant Reva D. Martinez in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Defendant Reva D. Martinez in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI filed and receipt confirmed by both counsel. No additions or clarificatons by Attorney Zilles. No additions or clarifications by DA Blader.  Statement by DA Blader regarding page 5 and correction. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zilles. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 8 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 4 years Initial Confinement & 4 years Extended Supervision. Consecutive to any sentence. CONDITIONS of ES: AODA & follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to make her supervising agent aware of any prescription prior to the prescription being filled. Single physician to issue or approve any prescription the defendant receives. Costs to include $400 Drug Buy Reimbursementto be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all inmate earnings received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. DNA surcharge and sample to be provided. Court admonishes defendant regarding expungement of DNA. Court finds defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Appeal Rights Given.
